info.title: New DEV
info.description: This is an overview of the API documentation. It provides detailed information about the available endpoints, request/response formats, and authentication methods. The documentation is generated automatically based on the API routes and their associated documentation comments.

post.summary: Change password using a reset token

content.description: Boolean indicating whether the operation was successful or not

creating_password.description: Whether the token is for creating a new password

content.description: Boolean indicating whether the operation was successful or not
Boolean indicating whether the operation was successful or not

post.summary: Log in a user with email and password

id.description: ID of the user the tokens are assigned to

expires_in.description: Time in seconds for how long the access token is valid for

content.description: Message indicating that invalid login credentials such as email, password, etc. were provided.

post.summary: Refresh access token using refresh token

refresh_token.description: Refresh token to generate an access token from

token_type.description: Type of the new access token

expires_in.description: Time in seconds for how long the access token is valid for

content.description: Boolean indicating whether the operation was successful or not
Boolean indicating whether the operation was successful or not

id.description: ID of the user the tokens are assigned to

expires_in.description: Time in seconds for how long the access token is valid for

parameters.name: integration_id
parameters.description: Integration ID of the OAuth provider

post.summary: Revoke OAuth access for the authenticated user

content.description: Boolean indicating whether the operation was successful or not

get.summary: Prepare 2FA Authentication (for the setup first only)

post.summary: Confirm and enable 2FA Authentication (after setup first only)

code.description: Two-factor authentication code provided by the user

post.summary: Disable two-factor authentication for the authenticated user

content.description: Boolean indicating whether the operation was successful or not

get.summary: Generate new recovery codes for the authenticated user
Return an empty response simply to trigger the storage of the CSRF cookie in the browser

patch.summary: Update the authenticated user's profile settings

content.description: Boolean indicating whether the operation was successful or not
Boolean indicating whether the operation was successful or not

get.summary: Request a data export for the authenticated user

content.description: Boolean indicating whether the operation was successful or not

get.summary: Download exported data for a user
Check the status of a user data export

status.description:
Status of the data export request | | |---| | `queued`
Data export is queued for processing | | `processing`
Data export is currently being processed | | `completed`
Data export has been completed successfully | | `failed`
Data export has failed | | `not_found`
Data export is not found |

valid_until.description: The date until the exported data is available, null if not available

put.summary: Update the authenticated user's notification settings

content.description: Boolean indicating whether the operation was successful or not

post.summary: Send a verification email to the authenticated user

content.description: Boolean indicating whether the operation was successful or not

post.summary: Verify a user's email using a verification token

content.description: Boolean indicating whether the operation was successful or not

post.summary: Get login activity for the authenticated user with pagination

data.description: Data returned to the requested page

total.description: Total number of entries across all pages

current_page.description: Number of pages the data is from

email.description: Email for the account to reset password for. Password-reset email link will be sent ot this email

avatar_url.description: URL of the user's GitHub avatar.

site_admin.description: Whether the user is a marked as a "Site admin".

email.description: Email of the user. If email is the same as the email of the user's account in the database - then it is considered and immediately marked as verified.

hireable.description: Whether the user is marked as "hireable".

twitter_username.description: Twitter username of the user (applies to a Twitter account connected to the GitHub account).

following.description: Number of users the authenticated user is following.

email.description: Google's account email. If email is the same as the email of the user's account in the database - then it is considered and immediately marked as verified.
Email address of the user logging in to the application.

password.description: Password of the user logging in to the application.

ip_address.description: IP address of the user logging in to the application.

two_factor_code.description: Two-factor authentication code provided by the user. Required only if two-factor authentication is enabled in the user's account.

email_marketing.description: Whether the user wants to receive marketing emails

email_notifications.description: Whether the user wants to receive email notifications

email_security_alerts.description: Whether the user wants to receive security alerts emails

ip_address.description: IP address of the user logging in to the application.

OAuthDrivers.description:
Enumeration representing supported OAuth driver types. | | |---| | `google`
Google OAuth driver | | `google-one-tap`
Google One Tap OAuth driver | | `github`
GitHub OAuth driver |
OAuthDrivers.title: OAuthDrivers

is_public.description: Whether the user's profile is publicly visible

email_notifications.description: Whether the user wants to receive email notifications

email_marketing.description: Whether the user wants to receive marketing emails

email_security_alerts.description: Whether the user wants to receive security alerts emails

name.description: Name of the user registering in the application.

email.description: Email address of the user registering in the application.

password.description: Password of the user registering in the application.

page.description: Page to begin the pagination from.

per_page.description: Number of items to return per page.

UserAvatarSource.description:
| | |---| | `default`
Default avatar source. | | `google`
Avatar source from Google. | | `github`
Avatar source from GitHub. |
UserAvatarSource.title: UserAvatarSource

UserDataExportStatus.description:
Enum representing the status of a user data export | | |---| | `queued`
Data export is queued for processing | | `processing`
Data export is currently being processed | | `completed`
Data export has been completed successfully | | `failed`
Data export has failed | | `not_found`
Data export is not found |
UserDataExportStatus.title: UserDataExportStatus

avatar_source.description:
Avatar source for the user | | |---| | `default`
Default avatar source. | | `google`
Avatar source from Google. | | `github`
Avatar source from GitHub. |

is_public.description: Whether the user's profile is publicly visible

email_notifications.description: Whether the user wants to receive email notifications

email_marketing.description: Whether the user wants to receive email marketing notifications

email_security_alerts.description: Whether the user wants to receive email security alerts notifications

created_at.description: Date and time when the account was created

updated_at.description: Date and time when the account was last updated

google.description: Data for a connected Google account

github.description: Data for a connected GitHub account

has_password.description: Whether the user has a password set

has_two_factor_enabled.description: Whether two-factor authentication is enabled for the user

token.description: Token to be sent for verification

errors.description: A detailed description of each field that failed validation.
